EYTwgOiMLdktdZ_pZpcB0w.text: Sushi for lunch... it's one of those rare (no pun intended) occasions where I can splurge and enjoy great seafood in the middle of the desert. I recently went to Kabuki in Peoria for the first time, and when I walked in, I was impressed with the atmosphere. The tables seem comfortable and the ambiance is above average.  The sushi lunch specials are insufficient for my appetite, so I chose to go with the Rainbow Roll and California roll.  They were wrapped well and tasted good. The food was what I expected; not really any better than any other place I can think of. For $20 (without drink) for lunch, it was a bit expensive compared to other sushi places I frequent. I think my expectations were too high. There's really nothing too positive or negative about my experience... I was just hoping for better lunch offerings that didn't involve tempura or teriyaki.

CQRnu7mbRhU-wR8WZwSbDg.text: Its sushi so its going to be a bit pricey but WELL worth it! 4_7q5TkhBALglq5wP9Uctg.text: We ordered the 20 piece sashimi platter and three quarters of the sashimi was still frozen! The red snapper tasted very old and fishy. I ordered a combination California roll sushi platter with no avocado it was made with avocado. We also ordered the Unagi roll which came to the table barely warm not hot. The server never came to check on us. Our server was horrible and not very attentive. Another server delivered our food. She didn't even offer to replace the California rolls. I was paying for the bill and asked for them to credit the California roll. Instead they handed me a to go bag and said that they had made me another order of California roll with No avocado. I told them multiple times I did not want a replacement! NEGATIVE 5 stars!!!! Will NOT go back.  To top it off they add their own gratuity and we only had 6 people. Qc3t42__Jgo5XQzhsvDzUA.text: Okay, my husband and I went there to celebrate our anniversary tonight since yelp gave them 4 stars.  We probably won't dine there again, their miso soup tasted strange, they probably used chicken stock instead of bonito (dashi), I was very disappointed. Sushi was okay but I want more sushi vinegar. My huband didn't like their rice, tonkatsu was okay but too thin. Since I'm Japanese and moved from SF bay area, I could be a picky food critic. I went to Tomo, Kabuki in Glendale, Akai Hana and here, unfortunately they are about same. With this economy all the restaurants are trying to survive, but we need good Japanese restaurants in west side of Phoenix. I just found better, cheaper and fresh sushi in Fry's supermarket in Goodyear. It worth to try and you don't have to pay tip. LOL

MR5D4Ct2RX76lN_1VJ3xWQ.text: I met an old friend here for sushi last night and was stuffed! these guys have a wide variety of rolls with different seafoods, textures, and temperatures. their spicy tuna is nicely seasoned and all of their food was impeccably fresh.  also, my friend told me that these guys aced their health food inspection which i know is important to some of you yelpers.  minus one star only because they close at 10. with good food and lots of beer i usually want to stay out later. so go here, but don't go too late, or you will accidentally waste your spicy tuna too.

iNuxYWccE3bA2b0-ZzDZ2g.text: Warning number one: let me start this review by saying beware all those from the East side -- this is not the same as Kabuki in Tempe.   Our experience at Kabuki was disappointing to me, especially after I chose the restaurant based on Yelp reviews.   Seating was prompt and pleasant for our party of five. It was an early meal, and the restaurant was fairly empty when we arrived. Our waiter had his hands full, and, to his credit, we were a table of 3 sushi amateurs and 2 sushi snobs all vying for his attention. Despite this bonus credit, he was very "first day on the job."   We ordered a few apps, including the gyoza and misos. The gyoza was well received and the misos were standard issue.   Next on to the courses, the timing of which was horrible. We made it very clear to the waiter that two of us would be having sushi as our main, and the rest would be having entrees. Unfortunately, this was completely disregarded resulting in a gap so large that the person with the first entree served was nearly finished when the last entree arrived. Not sure if this was a wait staff or kitchen issue, either way it was problematic and a HUGE peeve of mine.  In the midst of all this the specialty rolls we ordered, the Hawaiian and the Caterpillar, were served -- along with the eel, salmon roe and tuna rolls. The straight sushi was very good -- the tuna was fresh, the roe not fishy. The eel was a bit drier than what I would prefer, but the flavor was spot on -- not cloyingly sweet or over sauced.  Unfortunately, the specialty rolls were so vile I actually had to be "that" person and send them back. It was a shame, as they looked stunning and were very generous portions. But ... this brings us to warning number two -- Crabmeat on their menu actually means Krab meat -- as in the imitation stuff, and not just in the California roll where we all expect it (and I can avoid it). It seems to make an appearance in ALL of their specialty rolls -- complete with mayo. Yuck.  Now, I realize every place has their own spin, but frankly I found the whole thing to be appalling -- I've never seen a Caterpillar roll that includes Krab. And the Hawaiian just made sense to have real crab, given the other ingredients.   The hostess or manager, not sure who she was but nonetheless lending a hand, was very gracious in accommodating a prompt removal of these sushi abortions and supplying additional tuna and spicy tuna rolls (which were both VERY good). I give major points to them for handling the situation well.    While I was very disappointed with my experience, it wasn't all bad. Had we not had the service issues, I likely would not have sent the sushi back, but by that point I was already getting a bit on edge. So, I won't trash the place, because god knows there aren't enough independents on that side of town, and the items done well -- particularly the spicy tuna and teriyaki  -- were very good. So my advice if you're not of the Krab loving persuasion -- stick to the basics, and you'll do alright.

NbRaS42KeaHQjU4COr14vg.text: First off - we were looking for somewhere to eat in the west valley and Kabuki Sushi popped up on the GPS as being nearby. Thinking it was the same Kabuki that is at Tempe Marketplace and Westgate I was excited. Um. Yeah. Definitely not the same place. I'll start with the good:  - Service was very attentive and friendly (actually, the service sort of saved this from being a 1-star experience) - Huge selection of specialty rolls - Kid-friendly (the sushi chefs even entertained my daughter)  Now, the bad.  - The place smelled like fish. Not a good sign. - 99% of the rolls were made with "crabmeat". Even the Philly roll, which is very very odd.  - The food was very expensive for the quality. Two rolls made with mostly crabmeat and some nigiri, plus a couple 4.50 beers, quickly became a 70 dollar "quick bite." - The menu has pictures. Not very appetizing pictures.  I probably should have known better than to eat sushi anywhere in the avenues. And I'm still kind of baffled by how there can be two completely different restaurants in the same city with the same name? Either way, I will actively seek another alternative next time I'm in that area.

JvNK7FC1H3lWwxnWQqkqWQ.text: Great sushi! Great customer service. Delicious miso soup. Always fast. I always come here for some late Saturday night sushi. Thank you so much!

h0XC6VvYa1nizuglBgSOzQ.text: Great food and awesome service. You can tell there are all a lot of regulars that comes in to this joint. New favorite place....Highly recommended.

0tpVqdpMHh3HSkiQSsv96Q.text: Love the small non corporate feel to this place, I work in the area so i usually stop in for lunch, their specials are priced well and i always have something to take home to munch on, anything that is breaded is fried perfectly and grilled is grilled perfectly. 8dZ-iMPiBTI1CBMnwy7CVg.text: I wanted to love this place but I just couldn't. We decided to try this place again because I couldn't remember if I liked it the first time. Note to self if I don't remember, then I didn't like it. The food was not great. The service sucked and it was expensive.   Most rolls were $12-$13. I ordered the Hawaiian roll which was supposed to have tuna and avocado on top.  What I got was definitely not worth the price.   It was a slow night and we sat at the bar. The server brought us water and then disappeared for the night. Never came back to check on us or offer us more water or drinks. The sushi chef did give us a sample of a spicy tuna roll. However, shortly after that he made the worst noise anyone can make in the middle of dinner. He cleared his throat of phlegm.   Needless to say, I will never go back to this place again.

iUA8e-S5rOBnjCTKnDIvGg.text: Love sushi but haven't been able to find one worth returning to in AZ.  Lets start with the chicken/pork katsu. First off, get an extra side of the katsu sauce, you'll need it. Then take a bite and you'll quickly realize you can't stop eating it.. but wait! Save space for the sushi, that's why you're here right?  If you don't eat sashimi, shame on you. Try it, share it, love it. It's packed with fresh thick cuts of fish that satisfy my food cravings. Or try the Phoenix and Lauren rolls; one baked with lobster, oozing with a medley of flavors and the other topped with decadent white tuna creating a simple almost buttery flavor.   It's a bit pricey but why go get cheaper sushi when it doesn't taste any good? Also, the holiday decorations and music are a plus.

i-8iz1pS0EESHtRzrlAvDQ.text: Hubbie had a taste for sushi so we yelped and yelped and came up with Kabuki!  (We are in town for the week so really was at a loss for a good place.  A-OK.  We had very good fish.  We had a sashimi plate, Alaskan roll, and Cherry blossum roll.  And my mom in law had Tempura/tonkatsu combo.  All accompanied with a bottle of Shoju.  It was all good.  Even the miso soup was nicely presented.    Good choice!  We will be a returning customer for sure.

rdoZ7E1kOAz8MAta6HXMEA.text: I gave my first review of this establishment back on Nov 2010 and as for the food, it still stands as a great time.  The food is delicious.  Id like to review the visit this time.    My gifrleind and a friend all went to Kabuki for some Sushi because I had been craving it for a long while.  The last few times we've gone there it's always been a pretty good visit.  Quick service. Good food.   We walk in and are seated.  It's a little crowded, but nothing we've seen before.  They have about 5-6 people waiting tables or hosting or doing something.  A waiter asks us for our drinks and I throw in an order of edemame and some belly buttons.    ..and the wait begins.  Id say it was bout 10-15min before our appetizers got in and the waiter felt the need to tell us the edemame was '"fresh!" ... i guess that's lingo for "It's gonna be a while."  Finally they bring it along with the belly buttons.  During our wait we decided to put in our food order.  We got about three different types of sushi.  Nothing super fancy with a volcano exploding with fire shooting out the ends... just some regular sushi.  I kid you not, it was about 30min before my girlfriend could not hold back and finally asked the waiter why it was taking so long.   Apparently they had just two people before making sushi.  Well ya know what? We've been there before when just one guy was there and it was faster service.  We got our food finally, but instead of bringing it all at once, they brought two then one.  Ok fine... Im hungry.  We eat our food and get our bill..  The bill comes out to roughly $55.  With a tip we all decided to split the bill three ways.  Two of us had cards and put $22.00 on each and one had cash and did $22.00 so they had a tip.  Not rocket science right?  He walks away with our cards and cash and literally 10min later we all get up disgusted..  "Can we have our checks to sign?"  The girl pipes in "Oh they are right here.." I guess they didn't think we needed to sign anything.  I saw my bill for $22 and put a slash through the tip and signed  and we walked out.  (remember.. we left the tip in cash).  So Saturday morning I check my banking online from my phone just as we were heading out of town.   A nice little note on my bank statement:  CHKCARDKABUKI SUSHI & PEORIA AZUS     $55.38   What the!???   Why the hell was my card charged for the full bill.  Did they decide to go back and charge my card the full amount because we were unhappy with their service??  Disgusted we called them and supposedly they are taking care of it.  It's Monday morning (when banks do their normal run through) and my banking statement still shows the same.  Love the food Kabuki, but you lost three customers because of the poor service; and we will not be coming back.  ---------------  Update.. they fixed my account, but the service was still snail slow that day.

17GXPKMFEVS_CzLvd4hsqw.text: My husband and I ate a lot of sushi while we were dating and living in South Korea. Naturally, every time we find another sushi place with a Korean chef, we feel instantly at home. Kabuki is an excellent example of this.  Sit at the bar and strike up a chat with one of the sushi chefs. Let them recommend their favorite dishes to you.   Whether I visit this place for lunch or dinner, I always leave happy. The staff is friendly and the food is great.  Pick a designated driver and then ask for a bottle of soju - our favorite Korean alcohol. Try an appetizer (maybe whatever is on special); Edamame is great of you are new to this kind of food. Have some soju. Have a roll or two... I like the Rainbow Roll, myself. Have some more soju. Maybe end the meal with some sashimi; then more soju.  Tip them. You'll be happy.

AVvIiFHzLP9QHLif0x973A.text: The food was mediocre at best. The order was wrong, the  spicy tuna rolls were unpleasant and the teriyaki chicken was burned chicken with very little flavor. I will not be going back.

y7VnKYRyIzWyLCPKv_bGQw.text: Very good service, delicious edamame, and I loved the complimentary miso. I'm very disappointed with the options for vegetarians, though. It was either a 4 dollar cucumber roll (which are small and a bit lackluster) or a 10 dollar full vegetable roll. I understand that sushi is primarily fish, but I wouldve loved a few more options. At least make cucumber roll proportional to the cost.

h2KBlrbrTKEYtMDlZU7o9w.text: They have a very good selection of Sushi, and other items for you lovers of cooked food. They have a good bar menu and the service is fast and friendly. The atmosphere is very nice and the restaurant is clean.

Ov6AsyRULyEmYId-xTEpKw.text: Way over priced for sushi that aint good taste all the same ....i order 4 rolls and a chicken Teriyaki.dinner  and the chicken was dry as hell no flavor.and some how my bill was 90 bucks never again will i go to this over priced fake sushi spot ..people that know good sushi will agree .not one roll  wowed me ..server sucked she walked by me 4 times before she refilled my water and the place was empty ...

t3ICrtMbuBYb5a_k9K7cXg.text: Had a Hawaii roll, with the best tuna! Very pleasantly surprised by our meal. All of our food was top notch. We always look forward to sushi because we don't get it very often... living in Northwest Iowa. We weren't disappointed with this spur of the moment decision.

flMRTFiEZQPdlf9NW5WK2Q.text: Great experience. This is a neighborhood "joint" that serves good sushi. Loved the crunch roll. Tempura could have been a little bit lighter in texture, but it still quite good. I also recommend the sake bombs, if you don't need to drive.

HkDzVYYZCGHLwSq0TgxGag.text: This used to be my favorite place until a small worm was on my roll.  We took a video of it and management offered to pay for meals. Never will eat there again.

uDBLpAFqPcoJN0J8XlEGEg.text: I've been to a couple sushi restaurants in the Glendale/Peoria area and I must say that Kabuki takes the cake! I stopped by on a Monday evening and it just so happened to be Happy Hour! They have an amazing deal where you can get two rolls and and an appetizer for just $15! Delighted by this news, I ordered the crunch roll and the tempura california roll (basically a golden rush roll) plus a two piece salmon. Normally when you get happy hour rolls, the portions and the size of the rolls are much smaller. But not here! The rolls and nigiri were quite large which took me by surprise. The food was delicious and I ended up having to take some home cause I couldn't finish it all! Not only was the food tasty, but the service and atmosphere were great as well. Needless to say, I will definitely be coming back again!

Zh6d1ITWG8Pq4giotKlMfg.text: One star for the service, one star for the picture of Heath Bell on the wall  During Spring Training, my partner in crime and I were both craving sushi in a bad way, but I feel like maybe Arizona does not have a solid selection of raw fish venues.  Everyone we asked either cringed at the idea of eating something uncooked or had no clue where a decent place may be located.  Now, since this was a weekend of debauchery and I was continuously mildly inebriated, I decided to throw my search into the Yelp app and see where it took us.  Kabuki it was!  They did have happy hour, but unfortunately the drink specials were only somewhat decent.  Come on, $10 for a large sake/large beer?  I can get that for half price in Cali.  Oh well, let's order a couple anyway.  The edamame was aight, the rolls were just ehhh, I mean, I didn't get sick or anything, but they weren't the freshest (we just had the spicy tuna and the caterpillar roll).  We had ordered another specialty roll which sounded delicious, but the chef started with those two, and after we realized those would be more than enough, we cancelled the final roll.  I really liked that he held off on that final roll, it was as if he knew that our eyes were bigger than our stomachs and wanted to give us time to realize that.  All I know is that next time I find myself heading to AZ, I will be sure to get my sushi fix here in Cali beforehand.

VyoHXbXtKequASLRMRghgg.text: I'm from seattle so Sushi is a common staple in my diet, and I'm very picky about quality, and presentation. While in Arizona for spring training my sister took me here, my son and I were wary about Sushi in the desert being somewhat picky from seattle. Wow! Not only is this Great Sushi, but top 2 all time for me and I've been to Japan!  Size matters here, the rolls are huge!, quality of ingredients are top notch and presentation is well thought out and fun! The catapillar, amazing!  My son and I rave about this place up here in washington. wish there was more like this.  The head Sushi Chef comes out and greeted us and was very inviting, a must next time i'm in AZ!

XuDliAZSQj80A1bq6V85BQ.text: I really wanted to like this place because I live within walking distance and I love sushi. One problem: there were little bones in my sushi roll. If I'm paying $14 for a roll, I feel like there shouldn't be bones in it, call me crazy. Otherwise it was ok, a little pricey and the service was nothing special. Won't be coming back unless someone else really wants to.

GgKJElNZOz6RmIWCaGJkuA.text: I like this place. Scratch that...love this place. Sushi is definitely in my top five favorite foods and Kabuki does it right.  This little place is tucked into a small plaza, and is never too busy, however, the service is always really great. A lot of the people who work here went to high school with me, so it is kind of refreshing to see some of their faces!  The food is superb. I absolutely love the "Rock 'N Roll" and their "Vegas Roll" is one to brag about. They have a pretty vast selection of saki and a full bar.   The only thing I would not recommend here is their White Russian. Ick. Normally they don't come in such tall glasses, and this one is just overkill. Too much of a good thing is never a good thing.

8h5_DHzjoHqekDvSE8bRLQ.text: Phoenix Roll... So yummy! I have to say this place has great tasting rolls and it keeps me coming back for more! I've tried other places, but for some crazy reason I keep coming back! Call it addiction, or just  great tasting sushi! Service is great!

0e4XBLszpuYCDFjRuBcrbw.text: Used to be a pretty decent, friendly place to go. I don't know if the management changed or what but the service is super-slow now. And weird. One waitress we got pretended not to know what 'tamago' was then said "Oh! You mean /TOEmago/." Not only was that snotty for no reason but the fact that she was pronouncing it incorrectly made it kind of sad and funny at the same time. I speak Japanese and know the differences between 'to' and 'ta', as well as what the word 'tamago' means. In her attempt to make herself look superior and smart, she did the exact opposite.   I've been to Kabuki many times over the past 4 years and used to love it (this used to be a 4-star review). But the last 3 times really haven't been worth the trip. The sushi's not as good as it used to be and the help... definitely needs improving. I don't know that I'll write the place off completely yet but it'll be a while before I go back.

Y_3_0ILLpVo6sfsChn2FCA.text: First time here and it was sub par at best.  Little sushi restaurant in a strip mall. Service was a little slow and the Food came out slower. There were about 5-6 tables occupied along with 3 diners at the sushi bar. We ordered a few rolls, one being the Phoenix roll which was baked and tasted horrid of mayonnaise and imitation crab. The other rolls were edible and average. There was 1 sushi chef and he was extremely slow. We received 1 roll every 10-15 minutes it seemed. I saw manager in the back kitchen standing around who did not check on his Sushi chef but once. So it was a different environment than I'm used too meaning professionally ran restaurants with friendly staff and a sense of urgency are my choice.

OY81MW8b_PPqhbCGSEkuMw.text: Good Rainbow roll, rivals my fav at Sakana. Good edamame, not over-cooked. Timed nicely too. one draw back, the service was a bit lack luster, forgot our soy dishes and plates. Oh yeah, comfortable booth seating, not usual in a sushi restaurant. i will go back, hopefully they remember the plates!

sqGIVarz8xmYykvXNsmW_Q.text: I have rated this place before and I'm back to up them to 5 stars. My husband and I revisited tonight and we ordered the j-tom roll, crunch roll, and rock n roll. All three rolls were delicious this time unlike our last visit. We were extremely happy with our selection of rolls and I can say that I'm still in love with the rock n roll ! 31Jan2012 They've been slacking the last few times I've been in here. Hopefully they pick it back up.

Tw2B9ePXPVJwHx69WkbU_g.text: There was some confusion as my friends and I thought that this kabuki is the same as the Kabuki Japanese restaurant at Westgate and Tempe Marketplace.   I started my lunch with a soft shell crab appetizer. Soft shell crab was definitely not worth $8. It was one piece of tiny crab deep fried which came with a dipping sauce that tasted like tempura sauce. I then had a spicy salmon roll which was decent but had a lemon-y flavor that I didn't care for. My friends had a vegas roll which they liked.   Service was great and the place looked very authentic. Unfortunately, I probably wouldn't be back.

La3R0KFDvj46hz9YD8YPvA.text: Good food and good prices. I'm pretty new to sushi and I am working through trying all the rolls. Service and everything is great until it's time to leave, I push my finished plates to the side and I wait quite a while to get the check then to have the check picked up then to have my card returned (would be a five without the wait at the end) had a crunch roll tonight and I loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States

N7TWt232-2Yve9L85MvGlg.text: This is the best sushi place in town! Staff is all fantastic, sushi is fresh and the sushi chefs are amazing.. We have tried all appetizers and most rolls on the menu and you can't lose-- they're all great!  Stop in for sake and sushi! Great lunch specials and happy hour. Good anytime!

K0bE7hE7RFl5MNe84KmZ3w.text: This place is my go-to if I need a sushi fix. Service is always excellent, the drinks are delicious and priced well (try the watermelon martini or the Long Island iced tea), and the food is incredible. The servers always offer us miso soup, which is full of delicious delicate flavor and not overly salty. I've had pretty much every sushi roll on the menu (and there are TONS to choose from) and have yet to try one I don't like. Their spicy tuna is truly spicy and is an ingredient in lots of the rolls, which is awesome because it's pretty much my favorite thing ever.   Try the Glen Roll if you love the spicy stuff. The Salmon Tempura Roll is delicious, and a great choice for those who love sushi but prefer a cooked option. The Rainbow Roll is topped with 5 different kinds of some of the freshest raw fish I've ever had.   Dining room is small, but has plenty of seating options. The sushi bar wraps around the back corner of the dining room. They also do take out orders, and I enjoy the take out just as much as I enjoy dining in. I've been to Kabuki more times than I can count, and they haven't disappointed me once.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Salmon Tempura Roll, and Glen Roll in the background.

uhtn2k2EQVgS_5jd0K60AA.text: Garbage service, this server was high out of her mind. I marked with a pencil on a paper what my lady and I wanted and they couldn't manage to get our order right. They forgot a sushi roll as we waited like morons. Horrible service, the rolls(2)  were mediocre and rushed. The only thing they managed to do correct was getting me beer. I guess it's all a scheme. Wouldn't recommend. You are better off getting sushi from frys market place for less money. I'm alla about support to food spots as I am a foodie. But this place mad made me mad I even had to pay for such crap. Take it or leave it it is what it is and it sucks.

u7Uc_Jz8CpGqgnyevGS0Ng.text: I absolutely love this place, the food  is so fantastic, they have a variety of selection of Sushi and good drinks ,, me & friends having a very good time past weekend ,, a good place to have family & friends gather ,,  Love the place ,, I will be back

bSu5l3Z8BqsGzkKNbxbYSA.text: Phenomenal food, great prices, and great location! Try the Alaskan Roll and the Salmon there. Do not know how they do it, but they're incredible and heavenly!

DEdJ_pMWWT3VraMFl6OKWQ.text: I walked over to Kabuki for lunch while I was having my tires fixed at Discount. I ordered the tempura salmon roll as well as pork gyoza and it was so delicious. The order came out quickly and was on the less expensive side as far as sushi goes. Amanda was my server and she appeared to be the only one working. She was very attentive and had a great personality!!!

20qWKIf4BF02ElFA5-3Seg.text: This sushi lives up to its ranking... as good as it gets! The impeccable service, food, and atmosphere, accompliable to all ages, Kabuki will never dissapoint. With the best sushi you might ever taste i'll never eat anywhere else. The unique flavors and structure of the food is delicious. 5 stars doesn't do this place justice.

vb2Fash6BU86VSptYvyg_Q.text: We love Kabuki it is a great place for families, on a date, or on a busy night take out is great!

1kFpRHAcw-2lT8OdkppiKg.text: Kabuki Sushi & Grill is by far the best sushi in Peoria and surrounding area. The fish is always fresh and the service is A+! The hostess and waitresses are friendly and always greet customers with a smile. It has a fun vibe and is a great spot for families. I have ordered from both the sushi and grill menus and have yet to be disappointed. My favorite appetizers are Mighty Shrimp and TNT shrimp. I always enjoy both the Mango and Baked Lobster Rolls. A recent favorite has been the salmon teriyaki entree. Can't go wrong with this spot!

5k8iNHRiS9wNUdZIlNVy3A.text: This was my first time here as I've lived in the Peoria area for only a couple months. I've had a difficult time finding good sushi in Arizona so this was a pleasant surprise.  I have traveled to, and lived in, the Bay Area for years and I've had great sushi. I gave this place a solid 4 because I would come back.  Is it as good as I have had? No. But it is in the desert!  I enjoyed it and will come back.  If you're looking for a relaxing place to come have sushi, I recommend giving this a try!

P_qxnHoKI_VOZwKeCI8e-w.text: Great sushi and a very sensible price. All the roles were prepared with very fresh fish considering it's a far distance from the water. The service was excellent here !

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Great sushi and a very sensible price.

mMSqqJci07xd6mRi9VwnDw.text: I would consider myself a foodie so when I look a reviews I look at them with an open mind... however this is the worst review I have ever left .. and to be quite Honest if I could leave zero stars for this place I would . Absolutely horrible service. Our drinks were not filled to the top .. they looked like the waitress took a drink from them . We were not given silverware.. I actually got up and went to the waiters table myself and got the napkins and silver ware. The waitress forgot half of our order. Them blamed it on the lunch rush . However there was only like 5 or so people here . I am extremely disappointed in this place. We come to this area all the time. And we wanted to try something new .. I'm not a fussy customer at all but my god that was unacceptable..

_9ittQTmF0e6fonkF_MzfQ.text: Very yummy! Went in about an hour before close and they still treated us very well. I love sushi so I will be going back here soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. J-something, I forget. We asked for the hottest roll and this was it. It was very good!
Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Cactus roll. I love me some eel (unagi)! It was a Cali roll with eel, avocado, and eel sauce on top.

BQKPr7aZzxT8rZjCUsE2ZA.text: A nice little place with a sushi bar you can sit at and booths as well.  they were very nice when we went in.  Service is great and so is the food.  We ordered the FAQ, the letters are what used to be on the specials board it seems but now is on the regular menu.  The previous menu is all numbered.  I like that the menu has good descriptions and color pictures!  F - Lobster Roll - This was baked and just absolutely amazing, it's rare to have warm sushi and this definitely his the spot A - Hawaiian Crunch -  Q - Sarenda Roll -   I can't remember A and Q, but one was spicy tuna and the other salmon.  Both were very good and had a more refreshing cleanness to them  The miso soup was the best I had ever had, not just floaty crap all over but nice thick and had some good taste to it!  I normally hate miso soup, and last time I had it, it was acceptable (that was a year or two ago since I actually live in Chicago), but this time it was great and I'd order it again!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States

_MCTF2AHHJQPC4U4faP3rA.text: Kabuki is never a disappointment.  Not for the half a dozen plus times I've gone there.  The service always comes with a smile.  Though I still consider myself a sushi-novice after a certain number of years, I like the adventure of trying new items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Tofu, white rice, sauteed asparagus and dumplings (to come).

xmmRQQ9WMjtx_bE8sqq-rQ.text: This is my favorite place and it bums me out because the service has been horrible my last two visits. I see my appetizer waiting to be brought to my table for ten minutes. I got my miso soup at the end of the meal. Drinks didn't  get refilled. The food is always good but the service has really gone downhill. Please fix this! I always recommend this place. I'm really bummed!!!  Update..... They actually had two waitresses and a hostess tonight. Service so much better! Food is amazing as always!

hAQSWDttHmg2OvgMpToamg.text: Seems to be the best Sushi for the price that I have had here in Phoenix.  The restaurant itself is not so special, strip mall special, but the food and service were more than fine.  We had a native Japanese friend with us and she spoke favorably of the items she tried.

Txl_6zTAFfW0eJWl9XleTA.text: Went here last week for a date night. The entree we ordered was good but I wouldn't say it was worth the price. I've had better sushi. Service was good only issue was the plates on the table were dirty and was the silverware. On a positive note they played amazing music

R08vva32xT6SFr-V-jIJvg.text: First, there aren't enough regular rolls for me. Having some staple nigiri and just some basic rolls would have helped me enjoy my visit. Most of the rolls are specialty rolls and definitely priced like it.  Honestly, price is a big thing for me. I'm not saying I won't pay well for good food. But, these prices seem exorbitant for just OK sushi. I could get a better price and similar quality at my favorite revolving sushi place.

vabBSTay_aBYDOwZC7mIZg.text: Came here for the first time today and received incredible service. All the food was on point as I tried the Dynamite Roll, Melody Roll, Salmon Collar with Ponzu sauce. We finished the night off with some over the top fried vanilla ice cream with chocolate, definitely a must try. The wait-staff serving us was top notch and checked on us often to get us refills on drinks and hot tea. Great place to watch March Madness or sports games as they have well-placed TVs and the vibe is definitely great here. Everything we tried was amazing, can't wait to come back and try new things on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Fried Ice Cream - you must have it!

MqqWD8f_fZUpWH2qUdCBcQ.text: Truly enjoy this place.  I have never been a big fan of sushi for a meal, but the rolls here are delicious.  I am personally addicted to the Phoenix roll.  Nice menu.  Great staff.

HWN_gBJapEH30hVn5j5E7Q.text: This place is my favorite sushi place in AZ so far. The food is delicious and the wait staff was super helpful and knowledgeable.

9cBcOnOPr4GQPFPbM6fi5Q.text: Delicious rolls! I've ordered here at least a dozen times and never have been disappointed.

0tSWvU3R4qAJnGh-T69JOg.text: Best sushi on the West Side. Melody roll is my favorite.  I wish they served Diet Coke though. Service is great and very quick.

L7FLkJpXyqFY6XrpxWnXyA.text: Great atmoshpere. Great Sushi. Service was awesome and made sure we had everything we need. Really loved the sun kissed roll wrapped in cucumber!

99QUamwV58Mxe92jzNH_bQ.text: If you want to clear out your intestines than I suggest you eat here.  I came here for some sushi and 15 min after leaving I could barely make it to the bathroom without sh!tting my pants. Spent 30 minutes in a Walmart bathroom. Awesome.

pSMSz-tlrFnRC5BUCnkOYw.text: Lunch stop during the week, after Mani pedis next door.  Sushi bar meets sports bar!  Great lunch special selections but the selection of beers was equally as impressive.  TV screens abound, so to have a view from every seat.  The waitress was very knowledgeable as to the roll descriptions.  The pictures on the back wall, of all the celebrities and sports icons, were fun to peruse. I bet this place is hopping at night, being just south of the Arrowhead baseball compound and training center.   My mom and I each chose a combo and shared an edamame appetizer.  Service was swift.  Food was fresh.  Glad to have found good sushi spot in the area.

rUaZ2tG23zOchY5UZdpHMA.text: I went with 2 friends, and we decided to order a couple of the sushi rolls...we went with the Alaska Roll, the Vegas Roll, the Hawaii Roll, the Lobster Roll and some salmon nagiri.  Everything was amazing!  We had fun mixing and matching.  My only issue was, the Lobster Roll didn't have any mention of a Dynamite Sauce on it in the menu, so I wasn't able to eat it (the reason for not giving 5 stars)...I'm a wuss when it comes to spicy things.  But, my friends enjoyed it.  Also, Amanda, our server, was a delight to have serving us.  We left feeling like she was an addition to our little friend group.  When we go back (and we will!), I truly hope she's working that day.

2yCjZuWeLn32__CinHnRVA.text: Went during lunch time and it was refreshingly quiet. The waitress was very friendly and seated us immediately. She was very attentive and helped us make our roll choices. The garlic edamame was delicious. However, the baked roll we had lacked a lot. The scallops on top were a little tough, and baking the roll left it very mushy. However our other rolls were very good.

nDBWWL0nbhdfnBbsTy0Xgw.text: We have been coming here for years. Quality is really good, and staff has always been friendly. If you look for good sushi, this is the place!

9FiQp7Pk7rnHg1_tUTLSQw.text: Awesome! My friend and I went to this place after a Paint Nite and were so happy with it! The food was very good, service was fantastic (our sushi chef was one of the owners), and the food presentation was beautiful. We have since gone back another time and enjoyed it just as much. Their menu is very extensive with dozens of amazing rolls to choose from. We had the Poke Bowl both times and were NOT disappointed! Very filling and super tasty! I can't say enough about the food at this place. My friend and I do Paint Nite outings a couple times per month and we will be heading over to Kabuki every time we're in the area. Truly a gem of a sushi place!

7Yau-HiBztoIDNdiZKRuNA.text: I eat here often and definitely recommend sitting at the sushi bar. The chefs will give you samples of the fish they are preparing. They encourage questions and are always friendly.

1ClVINNJwz1xqc3w_qFanQ.text: I haven't been here in a long time and the food is still as good as I remember the sushi it's not the greatest. it it's good they have all the normal rolls but I like there lunch specials 11 bucks you get soup salad cabbage salad your protein and two sides so much food and it all tasty the service is always grate I'll be back

ssJyalPkgmuVAEw_VQPLqA.text: Me and my family have been going to this place for years to fulfill our sushi and soju fix. Sushi is made fresh from the bar and the prices are reasonable! The staff is very friendly and welcoming, the owner is always willing to sit down and talk with us!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Their alcoholic Tokyo Tea is amazing!
Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Great selection of good quality fresh made sushi!
Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States

wYS0VhBjdTqo4ryCwy03Pw.text: First off, the waitress was a little too familiar for our first time out. The sushi had a bad after taste, the yakisoba has way too much Worcestershire sauce in it and the teriyaki was bland. Won't be back.

6Cubf3uZlvK0IbSolGyV3w.text: Last night was my first time here. We had a party of 8. They predicted we would wait about an hour, which was expected since it was a Friday night. We sat at the bar area and were given complimentary edamame and served some drinks. We only ended up waiting about 30 minutes, which was nice!  The wait staff was very friendly and attentive. Some of us ordered sushi with specific ingredients left out and everything came out perfectly!   I ordered the lotus roll with lobster on top of a California roll and it was delicious! There were so many options on the menu but everyone was ordering sushi so I felt inclined to! But I'm looking forward to coming back and ordering the spicy seafood udon or the soups!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Lotus roll. California roll topped off with lobster!

RVJR1NOJ-eufSFcZWr8qbQ.text: Went there on a Saturday evening. It took an hour after ordering to get our sushi though. Very disappointed with that. Servers were very friendly and nice. Food was good. I have had better sushi but it was not bad at all. The fish was good. I thought the rice in the sushi was a little bland and not flavored well enough.  The worst part was how long it took for us to get the sushi. We ordered at 5:50pm and finally got the sushi at 6:50pm. Others in our party were already done with their short ribs and chicken for 20min when the sushi finally came.  I won't be going there again. $15 for a sushi roll that was very late and was just OK in taste.

c1Dwxkr9fTIfnAQqX324oQ.text: I wish I would've asked the sushi chef's name, but he was wonderful! As was the server Amanda. I live super close to this location, but I usually drive to the one at Westgate. Now I'll just stick to the one close to home. Great service, I mean our sushi rolls were out in almost seconds, and really good food. Can't wait to go back! Thanks guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States

qK5iCxCu7dLrUeqkyqUDkw.text: Work right around the corner and love this place. Do lunch here often. Good  food and great service!! Definitely try it!  Teriyaki salad at lunch can't be beat.

Gm5jz1TAyvY9EPUsSUjJEQ.text: Great sushi selection. IS there such a thing as too much?! Lol. Wish I could remember which rolls we tried. They were great. Can't wait to go back for more. Next time I will make a list of the ones we tried!

037jHtPOaVP4oR-sfHYKTg.text: Great place, calm environment and the food was omg delicious! If you're looking for that quiet small sushi restaurant here it is. Only complaint was waitress was a little bit too busy at the end had to chase her down to get out check but other than that polite and efficient. Margarita was good too! Will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States

niIygtmDQG8NOtLSm5OPXw.text: Good fish quality and quantity. Enjoyed our meals here and decent happy hour selection of food. The rice was a little stiffer and compacted in the nigiri than I would have liked but overall good. Not sure if it was due to the odd timing of day that we came in in the afternoon but our food came out in segments and the flow wasn't quite in tune to other sushi bars with the variety we ordered. The timing of our meal was off, server was pretty checked out although there were only two other tables when we were seated. Nothing special to note.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Unagidon
Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Amaebi was good

A96bhouFwfLJNBbde0wfRA.text: Wanted to eat after the gym so we stopped here. We had the Phoenix roll and the Lauren roll. The Lauren roll tasted fresh and light just how I like it. And my boyfriend loved the Phoenix roll so much he said he could eat it for a week straight lol! The dynamite sauce was delicious. We also had beef udon, this isn't a noodle house so we got some pretty average beef udon which is expected of course and it was tasty and filling! The prices are normal for a sushi restaurant and the service was great. They even let us try some poke! It tasted better than most poke restaurants I go to. I'm overall great experience.

C5Av0adm7wg3ZuVoOfec7w.text: Food takes for and the EVERRR! Unless it tastes like heaven descending to earth with the glory of golden manna, 2 stars it is.  Update: Once finally getting it. It tasted good. Our bill was $75 for 4 rolls and kids beef teriyaki. So it's over priced. It doesn't end there. My husband and child got really sick after eating here. My husband right away (had to rush home) and child at midnight. They didn't eat anything else once we got home. The customer service was good though.

iS8G5sRlJrYdN2Qy7rBhVw.text: My favorite sushi restaurant in all of Arizona! Amazing quality, selection and service!

PPRRs4PE5M3CgKbVPfFQIg.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants! We went there tonight and our waitress  had a negative vibe  She glared at me when asking me about my order. She took forever to take our order. Than she brought all the food except for mine and did not mention one word to me about how long my food would take. Her demeanor was unfriendly and unprofessional. Too bad for her the next time we dine there we know to avoid sitting in her area. Please have her work doing the dishes in the back where she can glare to herself

Eg-24huQY5CVUu1ZcW3_wQ.text: Amazing the lady here was amazing Amanda the waitress was very cool and welcoming ask for her she also gives her options on what you prefer and like.

el82BIZDI_PZKbAC7Fx93A.text: We came here because they were able to accomodate our large party and willing to give us a reservation. That seems to be an unwelcome challenge in our neighborhood.   4 star SERVICE: Amanda was so much fun and made our night! Loved the cocktails esp my Tokyo teas!  3 star FOOD: solid but not amazing. We were hungry so everything seemed good but most of their rolls are variations on a theme. Take a basic combo roll and then keep adding another ingredient and it becomes more and more differently named rolls. That being said, the bombs and pink lady were quite good. Most of their rolls are either heavily sauced or flavored so hard to figure out how  good the fish actually was. But I did enjoy the mackerel much to Amanda's surprise. Garlic edamame was solid.   Overall, it was a fun night w Amanda with solid food but would only return if I had another large group.

vLbf2MYq4w_I6bgV0Kq5sw.text: This is probably my favorite sushi spot in town! The restaurant is super clean and the staff is so friendly. The menu gives you a variety to choose from, as well!

kYgvrljcCPNDbUJBBUVYrw.text: We LOVE this place! Today we brought friends for lunch & David's staff never disappoints!!! So DELISH!

jHmSZugSTKmnKJho6Qsgxw.text: It was my first time here, when my friend had mentioned Kabuki to me I thought he was talking about the chain restaurant, but they're not related. Good sushi, the rolls were tasty! Our server was very nice, she helped us decide on what rolls to pick. I was surprised by the wide range of rolls you get to choose from! They had a lot of options and what I loved more is that they had pics on their menu to along with the items, which really helped because I'm more of a visual person. I had a great first time experience and probably would return next time for happy hour!

bDUlnq-uFXp1Rzs8ryWDVw.text: Friendly staff great sushi! The pink lady was fresh and filling. If you can't decide what you want they will help you based on what you like to eat. Definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Pink lady and the tiger rolls

k9Ffi2zrtzIEyZPneOVQvQ.text: Best sushi in Phoenix area!   I have been coming here for years and it is my go-to for sushi. I try to branch out and explore other sushi restaurants but they don't compete.   The sushi rolls are always awesome (love their new Surf n Turf roll!) And the employees are always nice and welcoming. As a regular customer, I love coming here and catching up with everyone!

G-GGBUw-hG2XKuoye4416g.text: Great place !! Prices are good and KIM was amazing !!! Food was good! A great place to stop and try!!!

ZIkmCxd85256eMRf9vIuUw.text: I found this place by accident; a fantastic accident! My friend and I are Paint Nite enthusiasts. We were at the bar next door for Paint Nite. The Yelp reviews were pretty clear that the bar's food was subpar. My friend asked if we wanted to try this place for sushi. Being from Seattle, it's hard to find decent fish in the dessert. But, you're equally hard pressed to find decent Mexican food up there.  The quality of the fish is unmatched; it's so fresh you'd cry tears of joy. I hadn't ever had a poke bowl before, but it had everything in it that I enjoy eating. I've been hooked ever since. I definitely get cravings for their food.   One of the owners was our sushi chef, and he's very kind. I mentioned that I hadn't ever had eel before, so he gave my friend and me generous samples to taste. Nom, nom, nom.   I don't like Americanized roles-mayo on rice? That's just not right. Their selection of rolls is diverse enough to accommodate me. I highly recommend the Pink Princess Roll. It's a painting on the plate and a party for your mouth. Both the unagi and poke bowls are a must. The unagi is just so savory. And if you are a carnivore, don't forget the teriyaki beef roll.   The restaurant is always kept very clean; clean bathrooms mean a clean kitchen, too. Several of the employees have been working there since there restaurant opened. That, to me, speaks volumes about the efficiency and the quality of the place. The servers always are polite and upbeat.   This has become my favorite sushi place in Phoenix. It's about 25 min away from my house, but I'm always willing to make the drive for good food.

YuGh_z5k8c3vPIlTh2moYw.text: I will never come to this kabuki again definitely will always go to the westgate location. Service sucked and the good took forever to come and all we ordered was sushi. Even are ice cream took 10 mins. And the food tasted terrible as well.

X3xtsI8izomez_oxwXlVEg.text: Good food. Great atmosphere. Fun awesome server! We had last Vegas roll, j Tom (spicy), and catterpillar. All really good. Great portions. Decent prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Very nice server!

6JIAeTX4WmmjcKaC1S_-Dg.text: Best sushi and sake place I know! Been coming here for years, and I'm always so amazed at how beautiful and delicious this food is here. I come here for my birthday, for dates for graduations, just to have a nice night. This place is definitely my idea of a fun and tasty night. will forever be in my heart and I will always want to come back! It's my #1 pick for favorite restaurant ever hands down!!

VdduI_ukGn9WZiW_zxWDsg.text: Love this place!! Me and my husband go to a lot of sushi restaurant but nothing con pairs to this place. Highly recommend  it.

QqWqerJq_n7Dxsi-olomMw.text: Went there for lunch.  Service was quick and friendly but the food was below par.  Teriyaki chicken was ok, but quite salty.  As a matter of fact, everything was a bit too salty for my tastes.  Even the salad.  For the location and quality of the food, I would consider it quite expensive and not worth it.  $14.99 for a lunch entree and a drink is pretty high for this part of town.

KNrVHG6yX5CAoocQ8ONtgw.text: This place was ok.  We ordered sushi and the three lunch combo.  Spicy tuna roll was not as I expected but overall worth three stars.

ybnpQxU9DKAZZm2XTxq8MA.text: The best sushi place in Peoria ! Friendly staff & quality food. If your here Monday-Friday request Lauren. She is the best !

VHyp4ipl9oDZwk2T6DwIhg.text: I have tried many of their rolls and if this review was strictly based on the sushi I would give it a 3.5.  The sushi is exactly that.  It is just slightly above average.  The other .5 was added due to the service.  I have never received bad service here.  They are always fairly prompt and adequately friendly.  Decent sushi and good service.

rVbwCe4gwWJooo6MIGpSlw.text: It wasn't the greatest sushi I've had. But it wasn't too bad either. I'd possibly stop by again if I was hungry for sushi and was in this area. But I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to go there.

bfzl0-Yfvtv2e4rEZg7jFg.text: I loved the food here. It was the best sushi that I have tried in Arizona so far. The service was so so but I can't wait to go back and see if it was a one off experience. My caterpillar roll was one of the best I've had and sashimi tasted fresh and not at all "fishy"

QbIuvx1QXzNMjlU4YVdQ4A.text: Love this place.  Great service.  Very clean.  The Phoenix roll is a must.  They usually have a couple games playing on TV.  My dad has taken his boss here, my grandma had her first sushi here...  in fact, I think I want to go tonight.  Yum.  Oh, I also think it is very affordable.  The fancy rolls are $13.

NFSzB-UgmvaryO_63u6JcA.text: Delicious, I love the Alaskan roll and the Hawaiin roll.

vLeu6jOJju45Wz0tDq1OUA.text: This is one of the best sushi places I have ever tasted!  From prompt service to the variety of rolls, this is the place to go for sushi.  It is kid friendly and a great place to just hang out for happy hour.  You can even request a combination and they're flexible to make it your way.

L7YZJ8cbTIEk6LtLnddQ2w.text: My husbands food came 1 hour before mine. Management really didn't care, said there were other sushi orders ahead of mine. We will NEVER go there again.

vcq68PqtlRk-huwwuGb4Zw.text: The place is outstanding. The food, service is the best.  I have been going there for over 5 years and I am always happy and glad I stopped in . David and Daniel are the best. Thank you!!!!

QpsdrAYLETcSDNty62ld4g.text: I drove 60 miles (round-trip) twice to eat at this Kabuki location.  The service is great here. All of the waitresses are very friendly, outgoing, and professional. The food came out on time and the rolls were great.  This Kabuki is family-owned and it doesn't have a corporate feel to it (like the Kabuki in Tempe). That's a good and bad thing in a way.  Overall, this is a great place to get lunch with coworkers or have dinner with family members.

vq7-ErTaGLkRwmh3YRxp6w.text: Tasty, fresh sushi!!!! Love the staff they're always very helpful and sweet. Food is always good! Try the appetizer sampler it's awesome! They have some of the best Salmon Sashimi I've ever had!!

-VNrQuAnquPfsL47ojArCA.text: Can i do 0 stars?  Luck warm food Horrible knowledge of menu Suggested food i cannot eat after clearly going over it Lackluster effort on the sauces and flavors Watery meso soup The side salad was too heavy on sauce Veggies with the combo were from a bag of cole slaw mix.  Rolls were horribly put together Overall worst sushi place ive been

3txltwFpwTRhcOoDCozqFQ.text: I made a yelp account just for the sake of reviewing this place. Hands down BEST sushi I have ever had. Highly recommend it

Sat_7sSQy4CiTfL-Kg6HmA.text: My wife and I ate their for our weekly date night before going to see a movie.  Kabuki's happy hour is from 3-6pm, and offers a wide range of appetizers, salads, sushi and rolls to satisfy most people.  I'm definitely not a professional sea-food critic, but I've eaten at at least 6 different sushi places in valley.  Kabuki is one of my favorites thus far...especially for the price.  Vegas roll was awesome, and their Shrimp spring roll was very delicate, and tasted fresh.  The edamame appetizer for free was a nice touch as well.  I'd definitely recommend this place without hesitation.  Oh, and a 12oz draft of Sappporo for less than $2?  Pleasant surprise!

h_q112RqQBfWoOCbLyI1Lg.text: This is a great place to eat. Sushi and me didn't get along but I thought I'd give it another try and I'm glad I did! Because of this place I'm eating sushi all the time trying everything. My wife is not a seafood eater but even she is on board now. Awesome food

yF-UouaA0_Kdtf8mRQq0fg.text: Go to Kabuki at Westgate (they're not affiliated whatsoever) - drive away from this place! Don't expect this place to be serving Japanese anything! They don't know from tempura batter to panko.   Ordered tempura and received food that was dipped & fried in panko. We complained to one of the waitress and she said it was the tempura and walked away.   Asked to speak with the manager but got told that he is busy. (Saw an Asian man who seemed like a manager, he had a white baseball cap and a aqua colored polo shirt, walking around and talking to other guests, laughing and socializing.  He should've been told that we wanted to speak to him, if that was the manager).   Anyway, we tell the waitress again that their special, TNT Shrimp is tempura and how our food was breaded in panko was not tempura. We found out that this place is run by Korean owners (which is fine with me) but c'mon, don't even know how to make tempura?  Even if the cook dipped the food in panko in error, waitress should know what their menu should look like. Have eaten here for the past 3 years but we'll be taking our $70 business elsewhere.    Ah-So or Fresh Wasabi (non-Japanese operated) will do..., better yet, Kabuki at Westgate (excellent place, btw) or Sakana for authentic Japanese food. Kampai is an excellent restaurant but on the other side of town (32nd St & Bell).

BsLnh71Tbwo-vdIKPEnKfA.text: Good food. Green iced tea yummy. The service however was disappointing. We waited for a long time. Looked like they were either short staffed or the waitress just neglected us. :/

7B1_0H15NXDBXadwv76yjw.text: I eat here regularly and have never had a bad meal. Even my boyfriend who lived in Japan for years adores their food. His favorite is the eel while I almost always get the beef teriyaki. My favorite roll is the Vegas Roll!

z3tTRBLyAsdKQj5GXWVsgQ.text: We went there with our toddler and sat at the sushi bar. Our server, Amanda, was super sweet and very helpful. We ordered the Vegas roll, Lobster roll, and Cherry Blossom roll. We didn't say very long cause of the kid but Amanda was very understanding and helped us hurry up on out of there with boxes and our check. Reasonable price for the food, and our 3 year old loved the sushi as well. It's becoming our favorite nearby sushi spot, and our server Amanda made the visit the best of all the times we've been there. We'll be requesting her from now on :)

f2zbeDIli5_56g7GPmQLTQ.text: As a big baseball fan from Chicago, I was visiting AZ to watch some spring training games. I got hungry after the game and I found this conveniently located sushi restaurant not too far from the ballpark. I walked in at around 1:30, but the restaurant was packed!! Who would have imagined a sushi restaurant in AZ in the middle of March would be that packed??  The wait was not too long and the hostess was nice enough to offer a complementary drink to keep myself hydrated. As a big fan of sushi, I have had many different sushi from many different places. But it was a pleasant surprise to find out how good of a quality sushi this place was offering in the middle of a desert.  Then on my way to the bathroom, I found a giant wall filled with photos of ball players and celebrities. I guess this place is like a go-to place for the ball players during the spring training period??  Anyways, the overall food quality was surprisingly good and service was excellent. I will definitely be returning for some more next year!!

XXK-EqTwhJ8OFXilfPzrwA.text: I've eaten here a few times, it's always been good. Love the sushi, num num num. Must try the short ribs, so yummy. Thanks everyone at Kabuki

WVtm-iah5kFckpEVDNdKeA.text: I blew in here an hour before a Coyotes game, and really wasnt expecting much, based on some reviews of 'other' Westgate restaurants. Fortunately for me, I was pleasantly surprised. The place was packed, but my friend and I were seated immediately at the sushi bar. Our drink order was taken within a couple of minutes. I ordered 2 sets of the spicy yellowtail rolls, since that's my thang. They came up quick, and they looked great... but that was nothing compared to their taste. Probably one of the most spiciest spicy yellowtail rolls I've ever had. A single tear of joy rolled off my cheek. I offered one to my companion, who asserted that his sushi hymen was indeed intact. After trying it, he blurted out complements regarding the bite sized treat... so I offered another. But that's where my hospitality ended. These were so good, that I bogarted 10 of the 12 rolls. I'm not sure if the quintuplets were waiting tables that night, but I couldnt discern which waitress was ours, so I reached out to the nearest one and requested our check. And then we were gone... Sure beat the hell out of the pedestrian cuisine a la Jobbing.com Arena. And, I ended up paying less.

Qtx8b7FXj0lDXI7SZsYI5g.text: The restaurant is located in a strip mall, but not strip mall quality food at all. The Phoenix and Dynamite rolls were both good. The menu tells you what is both inside and outside the roll so easy to choose menu items if you have dietary restrictions.

BLKQAR5DZlP6sbDw5VXBaA.text: Pretty darn good!! Too early to give it 5 stars, but nothing to complain about. Good presentation, appeared relatively clean, no overpowering smells, and friendly looking staff. The staff appeared clean and happy to serve us. Food was not too pricey and was served in a timely fashion. I opted not to try the sushi this day because it's it's very consistent among the better local areas. We had the fire cracker app which was unique and AMAZING!! Definitely a must try if you've never had it! The entrees were awesome too! If the sushi is above par, then I will give it 5 stars.  It all comes down to the presentation and staff because most sushi places are falling behind in one or the other or both. I felt comfortable and important which made the overall experience very positive.

0O6rHNY4UgeUWQTrJQwLQQ.text: Oh Kabuki how I love you!!!!  My favorite go to place for Sushi in the West Valley.  Doesn't get any better than calling in your order and Ta Da  - Sushi at home in 15 minutes!  (I live close by)  Consistency is the key and I know exactly what to expect from Kabuki!

q4EqIbSTMVGQbEnfKRalTA.text: First I am not a sushi expert. I do know when I like something. I have been trying places close to where I live. There are many places close to me in Peoria. Until you start looking you don't realize just how many places there are. This is one place I had not been. So far this is the best place I have tried. Remember this was just the first visit so until I get in several visits and try more of the menu will I really know how much I like them. The star rating could go up or down. The service was great. The meal was about $2.00 more than I have been paying for something similar. It was better tasting. Fresh distinct tastes. I am looking forward to a repeat visit.

pQimfDa55cS3j_OoRt69MQ.text: I've been here many times picking up sushi for my mother but I have never tried any. I'm a recent fan of sushi (yeah....I know, something's wrong with me) and have been trying different types at various places. This place is one of the good ones! I tried the crunch roll and the teriyaki beef roll. Both were amazing! I got it special ordered since I do not like avocado (not my fault, it's my brothers!) and they were very accommodating. Both were perfect and the portions were huge! I have leftovers (who would guess?) for tomorrow. Can't wait. :) Will recommend this place to others and I will be back again.

vZBV1-lgrzCXosZe5thxdA.text: We have been to just about all the sushi joints on the west side of town but this is the place for which we compare all other sushi restsurants. The sushi is fresh and the rolls are plump. I highly recommend the Kabuki shrimp and the Hawaiian roll.

EyPwhO5q8Mby4Dsm8PTo6g.text: Came in with my wife yesterday and ordered a couple of rolls (AZ tiger roll, Vegas roll, and Philadelphia roll) they were all really good! The service could have been better though. Never asked for a refill or anything. Just brought out the check when it looked like we were done eating.

Mwu7JfwRGkujyTKUC99Oig.text: My husband and I were looking for a good place to have Friday night date night at, after my haircut. We yelped around and saw this place and decided to check it out. It's a rather standard suburban sushi place in the Arrowhead area. We got there about 8-9 pm that night, and the place was almost empty. Service was prompt and efficient, and we were seated quickly with menus in our hands.  The drink selection was... okay. I got the watermelon martini, which was good, but truthfully nothing to write home about. I ordered some tempura udon, and the shrimp tempura was crispy and fresh, but the broth a bit too high on the sodium content. The sushi rolls we got were nice, but not immensely creative. Well made though, with decent fish. I did ask to order my favorite- ikura nigiri, and they unfortunately didn't have it. I got ebiko nigiri instead, at her suggestion. Not my favorite, but a decent substitute. Fish eggs are fish eggs.   The one noteworthy thing that I did enjoy was that they had a good number of rolls with 'white tuna', or escarole. My husband and I love it. But if you do your research and google it you will know that it doesn't always agree with everyone, especially if eaten in large quantities. So reader beware- you may NOT have a nice reaction to it, and really that differs from individual to individual. Neither myself or my husband have ever had a reaction, and we enjoy eating it every time we see it in on a menu.   Overall- 3.5 stars, rounded down to 3. A nice place, but really, nothing to go out of your way to enjoy.

g-Ckp7SHZxlsz-8IsfkzjA.text: Kabuki is definitely one of the best sushi places that I've been to! The portions are very generous and their selection of rolls is endless.   My favorite rolls are the J-Tom roll which has the jalepano bomber appetizer inside and spicy albacore on top, the thunder roll (has spicy tuna on top and shrimp tempura inside), and the Heidi roll which has spicy tuna and cilantro (droooool).   Though the Happy Hour doesn't have all the specialty rolls on it, it does have an extensive list of appetizers and popular rolls at an amazing price!  I would recommend this to anyone in the Peoria/Glendale area. Great food and great service!

Us4P4uciqQQaDj9ts2l9WA.text: Love this place. There staff is awesome and foods incredible!!! My boyfriend and I always have a great experience there!

Uj5GU9Uxb5hhgtJWhn1-ag.text: It is a standard destination for me when I travel.  Either location, this one is a bit older and nostalgic.  Nice staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Checking in @ Kabuki !

uJm7JN_QUdH0vN__5ZU2_g.text: I absolutely love this place! I requested to sit at the sushi bar and was greeted almost immediately with water. I tried the Phoenix Roll, I highly recommend this one and the Las Vegas Roll! They also have really good Udon. I love that they have a TV, so I am not completely bored when I am awkwardly eating alone. Great prices, great food, great atmosphere!

DiwFVhNyW5xzrR-kY4lV7Q.text: Great place for a Sushi fix.  I always get the 3 combination plate.  With this you can pick from several items.  My favorites are beef teriyaki, spicy tuna rolls, and tempura.  With this plate you also get Mi so soup and a small salad.  A bowl of white rice is also included with the meal as well.  They also offer specialty sushi plates, but can get add up if you really want plates of sushi.  Another great offer is the happy hour Sunday-Thursday, 11am to 7pm.  You can get a bucket of bud, Bud light, Kirin, or Kirin light for $10.  Its 5 beers so 2 bucks a pop is not bad.    Overall a great place to enjoy sushi and unwind with family and friends.

aARPCTafiq2MV7i7dNT2PQ.text: I order the teriyaki chicken and it was very good. I don't eat sushi but it looks like the best place to be if you do. I do not go back regularly because cost is too high.

7q5okY49Snj75OEt827jmw.text: If you haven't had the dynamite roll... you must try it. It is amazing!!!! And they have red snapper shashimi here so delicious.   Not a big fan of the vegas roll this particular place serves.

oVbu-A4Ode4Q3GgjKWprlA.text: We had a very enjoyable visit recently! Food was very flavorful but I'm kind of a fan of hot food being served hot. Everything was the same temperature. The service was EXCELLENT which is what really bumped up this rating.   We tried a variety of dishes from teriyaki chicken, cactus rolls, the shrimp california roll, and the Arizona tiger roll. We also had gyoza, and the combination tempura.   All in all, this is a great little place and I am really looking forward to going back soon! Just hope they watch their serving temps.

lq_YCnNlzEeYohqa4jlOqQ.text: Walked in and there was a funky smell like old fish.  I was afraid to order so we left.

lqyW84YGEefuxuX0ECmAhw.text: It's definitely hard to find a good sushi in az, but kabuki is sushi gold. I went there today with my girlfriends for lunch for the first time and we were all "wowed" by the amazing varieties and flavors. We decided on ordering various things and sharing since we all wanted basically everything on the menu (sushi wise). We got the:  Spicy poki (spicy sashimi salad) Kabuki shrimp app. Pink princess roll Loberster roll J-Tom roll Vegas roll Samuri roll and Serenda roll  It was a bit of a splurge, but every bite of everything was simply outstanding.  Our server was also very attentive, pleasant, and had great knowledge of the menu (we had a ton of questions). We will definitely be back soon to cure our sushi cravings.

Kz49ZyYOmNi36iw_ndaVOw.text: Best Kabuki by far. I've tried all of them and this one even is the smallest one of all and is the best one. Staff on point. Food at the right time , prices and quality 5 starts. I'm going right now again. Definitely is worthy.

MY8AEGCRlv2gszN47ezneg.text: I went here with a friend because "that sign outside looks really expensive".  LOL  I liked it actually... I liked the inside decor, I liked the fact that they have photos of the rolls that you can order... and they have a TON of rolls.  The service was good... the waitress gave us happy hour prices even though we JUST missed it.  We were very thankful for that. :)  Anyway... the rolls were good, the seats were comfortable... they had a HUGE bar.  I enjoyed my experience here.

CIl-iAzQk7_QmNV3TJJJxQ.text: Delicious! Ordered takeout for dinner last night. We ordered 3 rolls - Phoenix, Crunch and Dynamite. Both the Phoenix and Dynamite were amazing - loved the scallops on top of the Dynamite. The Crunch Roll wasn't as crunchy as I'd hoped, but I think that's because we refrigerated the rolls for a few hours before eating them. The hostess who helped me was very friendly. The cost came to about $40 with tip, which isn't terrible for the quality of the sushi. I'll definitely be back.

MA_qM1f9E6hSMa3-WNSLOQ.text: This was my first time at this particular restaurant and since my friend was relatively unfamiliar with the sushi choices, I picked. I really wish I could remember the names of the things we had. They may come to me before I finish this review ("Come onnnnnn Red Bull, kick in!). Whenever there's a non-sushi regular, one has to ease them in slowly via the mandatory introductory "If you're going to actually like anything, it's probably this California Roll" routine, avoiding squid and things that protrude out at one's face whenever possible. So, the California Roll, like Tennis in that it's easy to get but difficult to master, was actually exquisite! If I remember correctly, the next roll was a Dragon Roll of sorts with eel, cream cheese and some other seafood stuffs locked in there. Again, quite good. The last item was red and and came in an aluminum foil viking ship. It too was quite good. All in all, a nice evening with a good friend, sushi and yes, root beer (for me). I'd go here again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Cactus Roll was awesome too.
Photo of Kabuki Sushi & Grill - Peoria, AZ, United States. Phoenix Roll. Arrived in aluminum foil Viking ship.

OywjBmQBl3c8HOdJ3oTFoA.text: I'm a first timer to Kabuki Sushi and found this place to be a rather spectacular place. The staff quickly greeted me when I arrived and let me have a few moments to look at the sushi. I'd of wished that they would have stuck around with me being a first timer so they could answer any questions I may have. Overall I am pleased with this restaurant. They have an extensive selection of sushi that is sure to please any craving. They also offer alternative sushi rolls with meats such as beef and chicken which I could to be nice. I personally had the J-Tom roll and the tempura shrimp appetizer, both of which were delicious. I found this place to have very flavorful sushi. I have tried several places that specialize in sushi but they all serve sushi that is very bland and boring. As a result I have never returned to them. I crave places that have selections such as this place and that make sushi so good that you wish you could make the same thing at home. The sushi I got was among the best I've had. They ingredients all tasted very fresh unlike some places. The albacore tuna was not fishy in the slightest. The jalapeno complimented the crab filling, while the secret spicy sauce and the torch seared sesame topped tuna made the roll explode with flavor. I will for sure be returning here as I left there wanting for more. Skip your trip to get sushi anywhere but here. I promise the flavor won't let you down.

yr7QLTS7ByGNYKrJo46p_g.text: Great place!  They didn't take reservations the night we were there, but hinted that if we came early they could seat us.  The wait was about 5 minutes less than what they quoted.  We enjoyed the food and our service, in spite of being seated next to the kitchen/door for the wait staff.

SyeyyMPCCgFOfTbfkcYdMg.text: Excellent rolls.  Princess & seared alabacore were both so very good & well balanced with flavores. Service a little slow for 1 30 with light crowd but other than that, super good and worth it.

9MgmqZPfmmHrvBCzcH742g.text: Nice and attentive service.  I didn't try the sushi, however, they offer a multitude of rolls. We had the chicken entree and an udon noodle dish. Okay food. Tad salty so make sure you drink plenty of water or you'll wake up to puffy eyes (not a good look).   Good location, easy to get to, and lots of parking.
